availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New Orleans, New Orleans Parish, Louisiana

body.p:
State of Louisiana
City of New Orleans

I, Walter Hicks Peters, a resident of the city, haveing been appointed by his Excellency, Thomas E. Bramlette, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, a Commissioner for said Commmonwealth, in this State of Louisiana, to take the acknowledgement of Deeds & other witness, Depositions, administer oaths etc and to have said office and exercise its functions in the City of New Orleans, State aforsaid, do hearby solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully & to the best of my ability will truly execute & perform all the duties incumbent on me as such Commissioner, under & by virtue of the laws of said Commonwealth of Kentucky, so help me God,
In oath of which I hereby set my hand to annex my official seal, at New Orleans, on the 11th day of December AD 1863

Mayoralty of New Orleans,
City of New Orleans, La,
Sworn to & subscribed before me, at New Orleans, on the 11th day of December AD 1863

James F. Miller
Capt U. S. N.
Acting Mayor

figure.ab:
WALTER H. PETERS
COMMISSIONER FOR THE STATE OF
Kentucky
NEW ORLEANS
